snippet: The success of La Roja, or the Red, as Spain’s team is known, has — at least momentarily — helped overshadow the country’s deepening recession and banking crisis.
abstract: Madrid Journal; tens of thousands of people turn downtown Madrid into a sea of red after the national soccer team's 4-0 victory over Italy in the European championship final; the success of La Roja, as Spain's team is known, has, at least momentarily, helped overshadow the country's deepening recession and banking crisis.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Raphael Minder reported from Madrid, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The success of La Roja, or the Red, as Spain’s team is known, has — at least momentarily — helped overshadow the country’s deepening recession and banking crisis.

headline.main: A Salve to National Pride as Spain Wins Euro Title
headline.print_headline: A Salve to National Pride As Spain Wins Euro Title
